explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 3 because of its flash point: 33.3degC (Solvent Pocket Book, 1997)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Since the fire points is 240 degC (ICSC (J) (2004)) which exceed 70 degC, it was classified as the outside of Category.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Diluent type A >=55%, Available oxygen <=10%, UNRTDG No.3105, Class:5.2, GHS Classification, Organic peroxides type D

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Two sorts of LD50 values were indicated as a result of oral administration in rats. And the lower value of LD50=5600 mg/kg (ECETOC TR64 (1995)) was taken, it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 4 from rabbit percutaneous LD50 = 1440mg/kg (1.6ml/kg) (DFGOT vol.V (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 4 based on rat inhalation LC50 = 4000ppm (DFGOT vol.V (1993), ECETOC TR64 (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Saturated concentration is 6961ppm and it is guessed that each inhalation study is performed in the state of steam. Since there is no data about mists, it cannot be classified.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since it was classified as Moderate according to the Draize method (RTECS (2004)), it was classified as Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2B based on the statement of recovering within seven days although there was irritation (DFGOT vol.V (1993), ECETOC TR4 (1982), PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.7).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Skin sensitization: Based on the test report with guinea pigs that sensitization was not identified(PATTY(5th, 2001) vol.7), it was put outside of the Category. Respiratory sensitization: Since there was no data, it was decided that it could not be classified.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there was only in vitro data for mutagenicity test, we presupposed that we could not classify it according to the technical guideline.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since it is not observed of changes, considered cause using 2-(1-methyl ethoxy) ethanol, of items as estrous cycle, pregnant period, delivery and nursing condition etc. in rat oral administration during premating to pregnant period (Ministry of Health and Welfare reports (2005)), it was considered as on the outside of Categry.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Addition to the blood (hemoglobinuria), central nervous system, liver, kidney, and spleen are mentioned as target organ. Among these, there is the report about the blood (much blood passed in urine), and the kidney (severely affected kidney) (PATTY (5th, 2001) vol.7). Although it is in the guidance value of Category 1, the kidney is considered as the secondary effects by hemolysis, it is classified into Category 1 (blood). Since dose is unknown and dose symptoms was weak about a central nervous system, liver and spleen, it was not able to classify.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (blood) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 2 (blood), since within the limits of the guidance value of Category 2, an anemia by oral (Ministry of Health and Welfare reports (2005)) and hemolysis (hemoglobinuria) and anemia (DFGOT vol.V (1993)) by inhalation were reported.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50>100mg/L of fishes (Oryzias latipes) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.00*106mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
